title: Ticket #6040: Cedar should set SO_REUSEADDR on all sockets
description:
LSST reports that running a large number of very short jobs, or running a lot of short tools can exhaust the number of local TCP ports, with a lot of sockets in TIME_WAIT state. TIME_WAIT is fundamentally part of TCP, but we can reuse these sockets by setting the SO_REUSEADDR socket option. Currently, condor does this on daemon core command ports listening on fixed addresses, but no others.

Being late in the series, we will not enable SO_REUSEADDR on all tcp sockets by default, but only if a param ALWAYS_REUSEADD is set to true. Note that these needs to be set on client sockets the tools use as well as server sockets in order to avoid exhaustion.
